channel.title: Simple 90° phase shift [solved]
channel.description:
This is probably an easy one for anyone that is fluent with this system.
What is the simplest way to produce a 90° phase shift on an oscillator output? I'd like to be able to create quadrature oscillators using waveforms other than a sine.
I see that there are some community "phaser" effects, but I do not need or want something with any controls, just a bare-bones, precision 90° shift. I've experimented with phase input controls on some of the oscillators, but it's hard to say if they're working correctly. Signal processing the output would be my preference.
Thanks!

item.title: Simple 90° phase shift [solved]
item.dc:creator: @JonasBers Jonas Bers
item.description:
@JonasBers wrote:

JT/filter/iqsplit does EXACTLY this. Also though, DrJ Multiwave is pretty much what I was looking for anyway, and already has quadrature outputs.

Read full topic
